newsitem.title: USA: RenaissanceRe files for 3 mln common shrs.
newsitem.headline: RenaissanceRe files for 3 mln common shrs.

text.p: RenaissanceRe Holdings Ltd filed Friday with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to three million common shares.
Of total amount, 2.4 million shares are being offered in the United States and Canada and 600,000 shares elsewhere, the filing said.
All the shares are being sold by a group of current shareholders including Warburg Pincus Investors, L.P. (Warburg) and GE Investment Private Placement Partners 1--Insurance.

The U.S. underwriters have been offered an overallotment option to purchase up to 360,000 additional common shares while international underwriters have been offered the option to purchase up to 90,000 additional common shares.
The offering will be made through Merrill Lynch & Co, Alex. Brown & Sons Inc, Lehman Brothers and Salmon Brothers Inc, the filing said.
RenaissanceRe Holdings, based in Bermuda, is a property catastrophe reinsurance, written on a worldwide basis through Renaissance Reinsurance.
